title: Maya Angelou Is First Black Woman to Be Featured on U.S. Quarter
sub_head: Coins, which have started shipping to banks, are part of the American Women Quarters Program
body:
Maya Angelou has become the first Black woman to be featured on a U.S. quarter, as part of a new program under the Treasury Department to celebrate womenâ€™s contributions to the U.S.
The U.S. Mint said Monday it started shipping the Maya Angelou quarters to banks. The coin is being released as part of the American Women Quarters Program, which will see five quarters featuring other honorees shipped each year from 2022 to 2025.
